intro: Stemmatella sodiroi, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stemmatella sodiroi is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
